page.title: 01Townlands in Drumaroad area
page.content: Our block in East Down is one of farms and link roads based on{drumlins.}The} central place is{Drumaroad,}a village of one hundred and fifty inhabitants. To the north, Dunmore Mountain,covered by whins(gorse), rises to 200 metres. East of this, Draper Hill,a drumlin, forms the townland of Scrib. Hills of scrub and farmland in Drumnakelly and Tannaghmore are seen to the northeast. Drumnaquoile (southwest) is fragmented by hawthorn hedges and stone ditches (walls). Drumanaghan, due south, holds a derelict claghan{(village)}Shanbally Undulating farmland leads one to the south-east where the{Forde Demesne} provides a view of mature beech woods. The{landscape}features pasture and hay fields over our whole area, softened by wetlands in valley bottoms. Modern farm residences prevail.Drumlin crests have overgrown{forts}(ancient farms).
